heading: Tuesday Night
text: Becoming partly cloudy south of Route 2. Remaining mostly cloudy near and north of Route 2, with a slight chance of snow showers or freezing drizzle, mainly near the Vermont/Québec border. Lows mainly in the 20s, with some teens in the cold hollows, and around 30 far south. Winds becoming light and variable.

heading: Wednesday
text: Partly to mostly cloudy from the Adirondacks and Route 2 northward. A rising chance of afternoon snow from Lake George and Route 4 southward, possibly mixing with rain in the valleys; a trace to 2 inches of snow, mainly over high terrain. Highs from the upper 20s to mid 30s, mid to upper 30s in southeastern valleys. Light winds, variable to north, except northerly 5 to 10 mph in the Champlain Valley.

heading: Wednesday Night
text: Any mix changing to snow from Lake George and Route 4 southward, and in far southern New Hampshire, with 1 to 3 inches, with locally higher amounts possible in the southern Greens and Berkshires; a trace to an inch north to around Interstate 89. Becoming partly cloudy north after midnight. Lows 5 to 15 above, north to south, northeastern cold hollows around zero. Winds remaining light, variable to north, except from the north at 5 to 10 mph in the Champlain Valley
